company: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
job_text: ['', 'Requirements:', 'Education:\xa0Bachelor’s degree in science (biology, biochemistry, biomedical or neuroscience) and previous laboratory experience are required. Background knowledge in neuroscience is helpful. We are particularly interested in individuals who are highly motivated and capable of working independently on their own project.\xa0', 'Roles & Responsibilities:', 'Other duties as assigned.', 'Organizational, problem solving and analytical skills', 'Experience:\xa0Prior experience in any of the following areas: general molecular biology, biochemistry, cell culture or animal handling/behavior assays. Ability to work independently, structured, organized, and goal oriented. Should have good communication skills, be motivated and able to interact effectively with other members of the team.', 'Performs other related duties', 'Strong preference will be given to applicants with mouse husbandry experience and/or applicants who can make a two-year commitment.', 'Appropriate verbal, written and interpersonal skills', '\xa0', 'Assist a senior postdoc with experiments using the techniques\xa0mentioned above and maintain several important mouse lines that are critical for ongoing research', 'Proficient in both in vitro and in vivo techniques, including primary neuronal culture, cell line culture and maintenance, Western blotting, RNA extraction, qPCR, genotyping, immunofluorescence, behavioral assays, perfusions, etc. Analyzes and assists in interpreting moderately complex resultsMolecular neuroscience techniques, such as HITS-CLIP, ChIP, ATAC-seq, TRAP, RNA-seq, and CRISPRAssist a senior postdoc with experiments using the techniques\xa0mentioned above and maintain several important mouse lines that are critical for ongoing researchHighly motivated and talented individuals will have the opportunity to work independently on a highly exciting project investigating a therapeutic approach to the treatment of neurodegenerationPerforms other related duties', 'The Schaefer Lab at Mount Sinai School of Medicine is interested in hiring a full-time research technician. Our research focuses on identifying the epigenetic basis of neurodegenerative and psychiatric disorders. We study how miRNAs and histone modifying enzymes contribute to the establishment and maintenance of neuronal identity and specialized functions. We are particularly interested in understanding the epigenetic mechanisms underlying cellular plasticity and their role in regulating microglia-neuron communication.\xa0', 'The individual will have the opportunity to become proficient in both in vitro and in vivo techniques, including primary neuronal culture, cell line culture and maintenance, Western blotting, RNA extraction, qPCR, genotyping, immunofluorescence, behavioral assays, perfusions, etc. Particularly motivated individuals will also have the opportunity to learn more advanced molecular neuroscience techniques, such as HITS-CLIP, ChIP, ATAC-seq, TRAP, RNA-seq, and CRISPR. We expect the individual to assist a senior postdoc with experiments using the techniques mentioned above and maintain several important mouse lines that are critical for ongoing research. Highly motivated and talented individuals will have the opportunity to work independently on a highly exciting project investigating a therapeutic approach to the treatment of neurodegeneration.', 'Highly motivated and talented individuals will have the opportunity to work independently on a highly exciting project investigating a therapeutic approach to the treatment of neurodegeneration', 'Proficient in both in vitro and in vivo techniques, including primary neuronal culture, cell line culture and maintenance, Western blotting, RNA extraction, qPCR, genotyping, immunofluorescence, behavioral assays, perfusions, etc. Analyzes and assists in interpreting moderately complex results', 'Education:\xa0Bachelor’s degree in science (biology, biochemistry, biomedical or neuroscience) and previous laboratory experience are required. Background knowledge in neuroscience is helpful. We are particularly interested in individuals who are highly motivated and capable of working independently on their own project.\xa0Experience:\xa0Prior experience in any of the following areas: general molecular biology, biochemistry, cell culture or animal handling/behavior assays. Ability to work independently, structured, organized, and goal oriented. Should have good communication skills, be motivated and able to interact effectively with other members of the team.Strong preference will be given to applicants with mouse husbandry experience and/or applicants who can make a two-year commitment.Appropriate verbal, written and interpersonal skillsOrganizational, problem solving and analytical skills', 'Molecular neuroscience techniques, such as HITS-CLIP, ChIP, ATAC-seq, TRAP, RNA-seq, and CRISPR']

['', 'Ability to communicate complex information clearly, effectively, and accurately as evidenced by first author publication(s).', '1. Provide technical support and interface with Pharmaceutical partners', 'Job Responsibilities:', '7. Works with the clinical validation team for regulated assay launch', '10. Supervise and manage Scientist and Research Associates, including training, mentoring, and review of employee progress. Communicate with Director effectively in regards to project performance and progress.', '4. Interfaces the AGS Director, Clinical Laboratory Directors, Compliance, Genetic Counselors, Information Technology, Project Managers, Bioinformatics and Marketing to assure efficient development and implementation of new technologies and workflows for each offering. ', 'Job Overview:', 'Hands-on experience generating, troubleshooting, and analyzing large complex datasets, such as those obtained from high throughput functional genomics screens, microarray, NGS, and/or proteomics experiments.', '3. Aid in technology improvement of existing tests, e.g. evaluate new reagents, protocol modifications, methods, equipment that may improve the sample throughput and or quality of results, or may provide budgetary savings. ', 'Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race (and traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to hair texture and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression (including transgender status), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.', 'Ambry Genetics Corporation is a CAP-accredited and CLIA-licensed molecular genetics laboratory based in Aliso Viejo, California. We are a genetics-based healthcare company that is dedicated to open scientific exchange so we can work together to understand and treat all human disease faster.', 'At Ambry, everyone is welcome. A career at Ambry Genetics is a chance to be part of a dynamic company that aims to improve health by understanding the relationships between genetics and human disease. We earned our reputation as industry leaders by responsibly introducing cutting-edge genetic testing solutions and continually sharing what we learn with the global scientific community.', 'Strong previous experience developing clinical or RUO assays for somatic variant detection in cancer using NGS platforms.', 'The AGS Sr. Scientist is responsible for the hands-on development and oversight of new assays, maintenance of existing tests, and project planning and budgeting for Pharmaceutical partners. In addition, the Senior Scientist is expected to assist in strategic decision making, stay informed with respect to advances in the fields of genomics, genetic testing, and promising new technologies/ approaches that support Ambry’s Pharma business objectives. The position requires frequent and close collaboration across AGS as well as external departments and is best suited for a candidate who can efficiently work in a goal-oriented research and development setting.', 'Ph.D degree in a life sciences field (Biology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field) with 4 yrs post-graduate experience', '9. Lead or assist in troubleshooting of problems of the AGS laboratory, as needed', '5. Research new projects for potential development. May include literature research for project utility and scope.', '8. Draft papers and lead or assist with data analysis and compilation for purposes of publications, patents, and marketing.', 'Proficient with a broad range of standard molecular biology techniques, such as PCR, qPCR, RT-PCR, nucleic acid isolation, molecular cloning, NGS library construction, etc., the output of those techniques, how the output is assayed, and the analysis and interpretation of those results.', 'Strong computer and bioinformatics skills. Programming experience and/or use of command line tools is a plus.', 'Ph.D degree in a life sciences field (Biology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field) with 4 yrs post-graduate experienceProficient in NGS/microarray/qPCRStrong previous experience developing clinical or RUO assays for somatic variant detection in cancer using NGS platforms.Strong background in and/or knowledge of cancer biology and the useful diagnostic markers, approaches to detection, and limitations of existing methods.Hands-on experience generating, troubleshooting, and analyzing large complex datasets, such as those obtained from high throughput functional genomics screens, microarray, NGS, and/or proteomics experiments.Proficient with a broad range of standard molecular biology techniques, such as PCR, qPCR, RT-PCR, nucleic acid isolation, molecular cloning, NGS library construction, etc., the output of those techniques, how the output is assayed, and the analysis and interpretation of those results.Ability to communicate complex information clearly, effectively, and accurately as evidenced by first author publication(s).Strong computer and bioinformatics skills. Programming experience and/or use of command line tools is a plus.5 -7 years research experience in an academic setting and 2 - 5 years industry experience.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate and work effectively and positively with all levels of the organization.', '2. Develop new tests with existing or novel methods for Pharma partners, including targeted NGS, microarray, qPCR or ddPCR, etc. ', '6. Design research strategy, plan experiments and budget, estimate project timelines, identify risks and contingencies.', 'Job Requirements:', 'Job Overview: ', 'Proficient in NGS/microarray/qPCR', 'Ambry does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters, third party recruiting agencies, outside recruiters or firms without an executed contract in place. We are not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received by Ambry. Such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Ambry and will be processed accordingly.', '5 -7 years research experience in an academic setting and 2 - 5 years industry experience.', 'Strong background in and/or knowledge of cancer biology and the useful diagnostic markers, approaches to detection, and limitations of existing methods.', 'At Ambry you will be learning, challenging yourself, and having fun while collaborating with teammates through the open exchange of ideas. We also offer access to gym memberships, onsite food trucks, “Lunch and Learns,” and more. Our outstanding benefits program includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, FSA, and generous paid time off (PTO) program. Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and we maintain a drug-free work environment.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate and work effectively and positively with all levels of the organization.', 'About Us:\xa0']

['', 'Mentor:\xa0Jake Chen, Ph.D. FACMI, Professor of Genetics, Computer Science, and Biomedical Engineering, Director of the ai.MED laboratory, Chief Bioinformatics Officer,\xa0the Informatics Institute, the University of Alabama at Birmingham.\xa0 ', 'During the COVID-19 pandemic, we will request an exception for recruited postdocs to work remotely at the home office. Upon approval up to approval, the postdoc may remain the current location, as long as he/she obeys the full-time rules and regulation of UAB and the ai.MED for work reporting during this unusual time.', 'The various positions will have a different emphasis on one or more of the following areas: 1) bioinformatics data analysis, using next-generation sequencing data, single-cell genomics, for cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes, and autoimmune diseases; 2) systems biology and network biology methodology development, using algorithmic, statistical, machine learning, and software development techniques, to extract, mine, predict, and interpret molecular interaction or literature-extracted knowledge graphs in collaboration of biomedical and translational researchers in the School of Medicine; 3) Next-generation AI systems, using late-breaking mathematical, data science, and engineering approaches, to address grand challenge problems in data-driven precision medicine/healthcare problems of the future.', "Postdoc Benefits: Competitive postdoc salary will be provided according to the NIH postdoc salary scale. In addition, all postdoctoral scholars will qualify for outstanding UAB postdoc benefit package, including health, life, and other insurances, the university's 403(b) program, and enjoy vacationing, sick leave, maternity/paternity leave, and other benefits. Candidates may also request additional expense account for awards up to $5000 for relocation expense, conference travel, and equipment purchase. Outstanding biomedical computing infrastructure and support will be provided through the UAB Biomedical Research Information Technology Enhancement (U-BRITE, http://ubrite.org/) platform that Dr. Chen leads at the Informatics Institute. UAB is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and family-friendly environment.", 'We are seeking skilled and motivated postdocs to join our interdisciplinary team of bioinformatics, data science, precision medicine, and AI researchers. An ideal candidate may come from diverse biomedicine/healthcare-related data science backgrounds, including but not limited to bioinformatics, cancer genomics, computer science and engineering, data science, statistical genomics, and biomedical engineering. Candidates should be familiar with R/Python/Java programming language, and experience in developing computational methods using Github and data science tools for biological, medical, or healthcare applications. Expertise in analyzing genomic and functional genomic data is required, with supporting evidence through peer-reviewed high-quality publications. Good English communication skills, including technical writing and oral presentation, are expected.', 'In this position, the trainee will receive world-class training to become leading researchers in translational bioinformatics and applications of AI/data science in precision medicine. The trainee will interact with multidisciplinary researchers in the Schools of Medicine, Public Health, Engineering, Science, and Business to research selected topics funded by NIH and the NSF. The trainee will be encouraged to attend and present at international meetings and workshops that Dr. Chen organizes in the field throughout the year, e.g., MCBIOS, BIODD/KDD, AMIA Annual Symposium, ISMB, and other IEEE/ACM Conferences on Bioinformatics. The trainee will perform primary bioinformatics and computational biology research, leading to both first-author publications and co-authorship publications. The trainee will also have opportunities to learn grant writing, mentor undergraduate/graduate student, guest lecture in courses, and prepare his/her path towards an independent research career.', "Dr. Chen's ai.MED laboratory(http://aimed-lab.org), founded in 2016 at the UAB Informatics Institute (http://informatics.uab.edu/) of the School of Medicine, has been developing informatics, data science, and engineering methods and software tools to understand and transform future biology, medicine, and healthcare. We work with a variety of data sets, including single-cell genomics, RNA-sequencing, public biological knowledgebases, including PubMed, PubChem, and GEO. We are well funded to study complex human diseases, including cancer, autoimmune diseases, Alzheimer's disease, diabetes, and psychiatric disorders. We develop and apply state-of-the-art AI and machine learning techniques to analyze multi-omics data. A particular advantage of the ai.MED laboratory at UAB Informatics Institute is the ability to perform bioinformatics analysis with patient electronic medical records. UAB Informatics Institute is the hub for biomedical data science primary research, education, infrastructure development, and service on campus, with nine core faculty and more than 30 affiliate faculties. We collaborate extensively with UAB's Center for Clinical and Translational Sciences (CCTS), O'Neal Comprehensive Cancer Center, Precision Medicine Institute, Division of Clinical Immunology and Rheumatology of the Department of Medicine, Computer Science Department, and Biomedical Engineering Department.", "Multiple postdoctoral positions open at the UAB's ai.MED Lab in the Informatics Institute ", 'Dr. Chen is an international expert in translational bioinformatics and biomedical data science research. He has over 25 years of R&D experience in biological data mining and systems biology, with over 170 peer-reviewed publications and 200 presentations worldwide. He was the founder of Indiana Center for Systems Biology and Personalized Medicine at Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis, and precision medicine companies including Predictive Physiology and Medicine and Medeolinx, LLC. He is currently President-elect of the Midsouth Computational Biology and Bioinformatics Society and an elected fellow of the American College of Medical Informatics. He serves on the editorial boards of BMC Bioinformatics and Journal of American Medical Informatics Association. In 2019, he was recognized by Deep Knowledge Analytics as one of the "Top 100 AI Leaders in Drug Discovery and Healthcare" and three-time finalists of Indiana\'s MIRA Award on "Technology Mentors of the Year".', 'To apply, please email Dr. Jake Chen (jakechen@uab.edu) with a cover letter, current CV, and contact details of three references. The application will be reviewed upon receipt, and candidates will be interviewed monthly until all the positions are filled.']

['', 'At Automattic, we believe in making the web a better place. We’re a distributed company with more than 1200 Automatticians in 75+ countries speaking 90+ different languages. Our common goal is to democratize publishing so that anyone with a story can tell it, regardless of income, gender, politics, language, or where they live in the world. ', 'The Woo Data & BizOps team needs a new Data Engineer. We help inform our business and product strategy by providing insights through data analysis. ', 'Perform exploratory business analysis and deliver clear and actionable written reports. ', 'Communication with and empathy for our colleagues is a key part of this job – curiosity about the puzzles they face is a requirement. Data can be unruly: you’ll need to be prepared to face uncertainty and provide your best guess sometimes – your work will be as much about architecting and improving data pipelines as it will be about creating excellent reporting and solving business problems. ', 'Deeply understand business drivers to craft automated, easy to use reports and data visualizations in our BI tool (we use Looker). ', 'Use your JavaScript, PHP, and SQL skills to understand and improve our data sources. ', ' About Automattic', ' How to Apply', 'Architect and improve data pipelines using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, Impala, and Airflow. ', ' As The Data Engineer on our team, you will:', 'Does this sound interesting? If yes, click the Apply button below and fill out our application form. In your cover letter, let us know what you can contribute to the team.\xa0', 'Work with business leads, analysts, data scientists, and fellow engineers to build data products that empower better decision-making. ', 'We’re improving diversity in the tech industry. At Automattic, we want people to love their work and show respect and empathy to all. We welcome differences and strive to increase participation from traditionally underrepresented groups. Our D&I committee involves Automatticians across the company and drives grassroots change. For example, this group has helped facilitate private online spaces for affiliated Automatticians to gather and helps run a monthly D&I People Lab series for further learning. Diversity and Inclusion is a priority at Automattic, though our dedication influences far more than just Automatticians: We make our products freely available and translate our products into and offer customer support in numerous languages. We require unconscious bias training for our hiring teams and ensure our products are accessible across different bandwidths and devices. Learn more about our dedication to diversity and inclusion and our Employee Resource Groups. ', ' Diversity & Inclusion at Automattic', 'We believe in Open Source and the vast majority of our work is available under the GPL. ', ' ', 'Be constantly raising data quality. That includes auditing sources, documenting issues, driving resolutions together with other teams, and implementing well-documented, performant, and tested improvements. ', 'We are the company behind WordPress.com, WooCommerce, Jetpack, and more! We are looking for a full-stack Data Engineer with a head for business to join our WooCommerce team! ', 'Work with business leads, analysts, data scientists, and fellow engineers to build data products that empower better decision-making. Architect and improve data pipelines using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, Impala, and Airflow. Deeply understand business drivers to craft automated, easy to use reports and data visualizations in our BI tool (we use Looker). Perform exploratory business analysis and deliver clear and actionable written reports. Use your JavaScript, PHP, and SQL skills to understand and improve our data sources. Be constantly raising data quality. That includes auditing sources, documenting issues, driving resolutions together with other teams, and implementing well-documented, performant, and tested improvements. ']

company: Loyola University Chicago Stritch School of Medicine
job_text: ['', 'Please send your application with three references to Dr. Qun Sophia Zang at\xa0qzang@luc.edu', 'A postdoc researcher position is available in Dr. Zang’s lab at the Burn and Shock Trauma Research Institute in the Stritch School of Medicine at Loyola University Chicago. The research area of the laboratory is focused on mitochondrial signaling in cardiac\xa0dysfunction and cardiac\xa0autophagy in sepsis using both in vitro and in vivo models. The prospective candidate will\xa0have opportunities to work\xa0within a highly interactive, multidiscipline team to do translational research. ', 'A qualified candidate must hold a doctorate\xa0degree with a major in biology or the area biomedical sciences. Necessary skill set includes a combination of the following techniques: cell culture, animal husbandry\xa0and\xa0experimental skills, tissue/cell staining, confocal imaging, western blot, immunoprecipitation,\xa0ELISA, DNA/RNA\xa0preparation, PCR, and real time PCR. Previous experience/knowledge in animal experiments is very much preferred, and experience in mitochondria study is a plus. In addition, capabilities to efficiently collect/organize/analyze\xa0data and to initiate\xa0new/modified procedures/techniques based upon latest\xa0developments are expected. Preferences will be given to candidates who are good at tasks\xa0and time\xa0management and strong communication\xa0skills.']

From car telemetry to transaction data and everything in between, the data warehouse will be the core repository and engine for leveraging the data. We are in our growth stage, where we are doubling our volume every year for the past 4 years.', 'Detailed: ', 'Problem Solving: You proactively solve problems before they can become real problems. You are constantly upgrading your skillset and applying that to be proactive about the current and emerging security issues and practices.', 'Drive data optimization through out the organization\xa0\xa0', 'Benefits = At Urgently, we have awesome benefits! They include competitive pay, medical/dental/vision benefits and stock options which give you a stake in our company. In addition, we offer short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, approximately 12 holidays off every year and unlimited paid time off. On top of all this, Urgently gives you free money when you save through our 401(k). We match 100% on the first 3% you contribute and then 50% of the next 2% you contribute. So, if you contribute 5% of your paycheck, we’ll match 4% of that.', 'Location = Great news!\xa0 You have the option of working from anywhere in the U.S. or Canada!\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'OUR FAIR HIRING PRACTICES:', 'Manager = You’ll report to SVP of Technology', 'Must Have Technical Skills:', 'Industry Experience: ', 'Quality Ownership: ', 'Expand the data platform to include 3rd party data sets.\xa0', 'YOUR LEGACY:\xa0 ', 'For more information, visit www.geturgently.com', 'Dedicated: ', 'Understand our current and future needs.\xa0', 'We do not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.\xa0', 'Quality Ownership: Your work demonstrates how much you care about the quality of what you produce and how it is performing in the real world.', '\xa0', 'Technical Leadership: You are a technical leader and are always mentoring developers, designing and articulating the design to a team of developers. You value team accomplishments more than individuals.', 'Technical Leadership: ', 'You should also know that we adhere to these same principles in all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, access to benefits and training, discipline, and termination of employment.\xa0', 'Work with other user oriented teams to leverage data and algorithms', '\xa0 The result? ', 'Take over the landing and delivery of different types of data to different usersExpand the data platform to include 3rd party data sets.\xa0Work with other user oriented teams to leverage data and algorithmsWork with Data Scientist to lay the foundation for exploiting AI/ML', 'YOUR LEGACY:\xa0 Your legacy will be the transformation of Urgently into a data-driven company and culture. You will ensure data is consistent, high quality, timely, and scales to meet our business needs. You will be part of the team that democratize data throughout the organization from BI and product teams to our customers. Using car telemetry data and other sources,\xa0 you will help us move from reactive to predictive assistance.\xa0 The result? \xa0You helped Urgently become the world’s leading mobility assistance company.\xa0\xa0', 'Your mission is to drive the collection, processing, and delivery of data throughout the organization.\xa0 You will be responsible for all aspects of the data warehouse from landing data, processing and delivering it to various other systems: BI reporting, ad hoc report, and real-time decision making production systems. \xa0 You will be paired with a Data Product Manager and Data Science team. Together you will not only own the data warehouse but integrate data throughout the organization.', 'Deep depth of knowledge around different data warehouse and lake technologies on AWS.Expert knowledge in the different elements of a data warehouse from data life-cycle, quality, governance, scaling and security.\xa0Not your first rodeo, you’ve done this a few times before and are looking to put all your vision and skills to build out the latest version of a data warehouseDetailed: As a lead, you create detailed documentation of what you and your team is developing.Dedicated: You operate the services that you and your team develop and take their quality seriously.\xa0\xa0Problem Solving: You proactively solve problems before they can become real problems. You are constantly upgrading your skillset and applying that to be proactive about the current and emerging security issues and practices.Technical Leadership: You are a technical leader and are always mentoring developers, designing and articulating the design to a team of developers. You value team accomplishments more than individuals.Industry Experience: You have spent 8+ years of data warehouse in similar environments.Quality Ownership: Your work demonstrates how much you care about the quality of what you produce and how it is performing in the real world.', 'Expert knowledge in the different elements of a data warehouse from data life-cycle, quality, governance, scaling and security.\xa0', 'THE NITTY GRITTY:', 'The ideal candidate for this role holds at least a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security or a related technology field.', 'Not your first rodeo, you’ve done this a few times before and are looking to put all your vision and skills to build out the latest version of a data warehouse', 'YOUR MISSION:\xa0 ', 'Location = Great news!\xa0 You have the option of working from anywhere in the U.S. or Canada!\xa0\xa0\xa0Manager = You’ll report to SVP of TechnologyCompensation = Commensurate with experience for a company of Urgently’s sizeBenefits = At Urgently, we have awesome benefits! They include competitive pay, medical/dental/vision benefits and stock options which give you a stake in our company. In addition, we offer short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, approximately 12 holidays off every year and unlimited paid time off. On top of all this, Urgently gives you free money when you save through our 401(k). We match 100% on the first 3% you contribute and then 50% of the next 2% you contribute. So, if you contribute 5% of your paycheck, we’ll match 4% of that.', "At Urgently, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our customers and the communities where we operate. We are an equal opportunity employer which means that employment and advancement at Urgently is based on a person's merit and qualifications.\xa0", '1) First 2 months:', 'Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and similar applicable state laws. Please let us know if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process', 'Compensation = Commensurate with experience for a company of Urgently’s size']

job_title: Associate Scientist, Molecular and Vector Biology
job_text: ['', 'bluebird bio is deeply committed to fostering an environment where diversity and inclusion are not only valued, but prioritized. We believe a diverse and inclusive community empowers us to act courageously, care deeply, and dream boldly to impact people in big ways. Diverse viewpoints bring diverse capabilities which strengthen our focus and fuel our growth. ', 'Familiarity with viral vectors. Knowledge of lentiviral platforms is a plus.', 'Experience in cell culture. Primary cell culture a plus.', 'Ability to work in a team environment, meet deadlines, and prioritize and balance work from multiple sources', 'Exposure to ELISA, qPCR, a plus', 'About The Nest', 'Strong proficiency with molecular biology techniques and plasmid cloning.', 'Should be self-motivated, detail oriented, flexible, and have a “do-what-it-takes” attitude with excellent organizational and communication skills', 'About The Flock', 'Applying technical expertise to develop next generation in vitro assays', 'What You’ll Bring', ' BS/BA in biological sciences. Research experience is a must. Strong proficiency with molecular biology techniques and plasmid cloning. Experience in cell culture. Primary cell culture a plus. Working knowledge of NGS library preparation and analysis a plus. Familiarity with viral vectors. Knowledge of lentiviral platforms is a plus. Exposure to ELISA, qPCR, a plus Ability to work in a team environment, meet deadlines, and prioritize and balance work from multiple sources Should be self-motivated, detail oriented, flexible, and have a “do-what-it-takes” attitude with excellent organizational and communication skills ', 'Working knowledge of NGS library preparation and analysis a plus.', 'BS/BA in biological sciences. Research experience is a must.', "At bluebird, only two things matter - patients and our people. When you join the nest, you're not just landing a new gig, you become a part of a flock that's soaring to new heights. We’re 1100+ doers, thinkers and collaborators across the globe with a strong sense of our values and our purpose. Our innovation and sustainability are rooted in the diversity of our teams and results are achieved through cooperation and the incorporation of multiple points of view. This is personal and we approach every challenge with radical care. The time is now to rise up and recode the science, the systems, and the status quo.", ' Working in a cross-functional environment to develop and create new technologies enabling new lentivirus therapies Applying technical expertise to develop next generation in vitro assays Engineering LVV to transduce novel cell types to create new cell therapies and treat new classes of diseases.  ', 'bluebird is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.', 'Working in a cross-functional environment to develop and create new technologies enabling new lentivirus therapies', 'Engineering LVV to transduce novel cell types to create new cell therapies and treat new classes of diseases. ', "How You'll Fly"]

job_title: AI Research scientist: up to $350,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'Coming up with new techniques in unsupervised learning, dataset augmentation, and deep reinforcement learning that can be applied to automating various parts of the AI development workflow.', 'General Requirements:', 'Responsibilities', 'We are looking for talented research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Candidates will need to have a PhD preferably in Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning. We are looking for people who have done research and/or published papers in one of the following areas: Unsupervised Learning; Generative Modeling; Deep Neural Networks; Deep Reinforcement Learning; Generative Adversarial Networks; Causal Reasoning. Ideal candidates would be able to rapidly build on new ideas with engineers, potentially publish at top conferences, and be able to write code.', 'Job Description:', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting-edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. We have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We are backed by Eric Schmidt and Decibel Ventures with Series A funding of $18 million.\xa0']

[' Experience in conducting economic or political economic analysis in conflict affected contexts is a plus', 'The Consultant Will Deliver', ' Work with the analysis team to understand the country context', ' Draft report (end of week 3-January 21)', ' Contextual understanding of Syria', ' Relevant academic qualifications (Masters degree minimum, Ph. D preferred in Economics, Statistics or a related field), and / or 7+ years’ experience in economic research  In-depth knowledge of monetary policy, understanding of the Syrian context is a plus  Knowledge of developing proxy indicators in the absence of public data is a plus  Contextual understanding of Syria  Experience in conducting economic or political economic analysis in conflict affected contexts is a plus  Fluency in written and spoken English is essential, knowledge of Arabic is an asset.', ' Undertake detailed desk research regarding Syria’s monetary policy', 'Description', 'Purpose / Project Description', ' Relevant academic qualifications (Masters degree minimum, Ph. D preferred in Economics, Statistics or a related field), and / or 7+ years’ experience in economic research', 'BackgroundThe Humanitarian Access Team (HAT) was established in Beirut in March 2015 in response to the collective challenges facing the remote humanitarian response in Syria. Successful humanitarian and development interventions require a nuanced and objective understanding of the human ecosystems in which these interventions occur. To this end, the HAT’s most important function is to collect, triangulate, synthesize, analyze and operationalize disparate data and information. Since 2015, HAT analysis has provided a forward-looking template for international interventions in Syria, and facilitated an increasingly nimble, adaptive, integrated, and ultimately impactful international response to the Syrian conflict.Purpose / Project DescriptionWith the ongoing Syrian economic crisis including the depreciation of the Syrian pound on the open market and devaluation by the Syrian Central Bank, to historic lows, coupled with continuous inflation, the HAT team is seeking an individual to provide a short-term analysis on key monetary policy initiatives from the Syrian Central Bank and Syrian Government.The consultant will need to understand monetary policy mechanisms within fixed exchange rate systems, understand historical trends within Syria’s economic System, as well as being able to develop proxy indicators of measurement within conflict countries that have limited data access.The purpose of the project will be to assist teams to understand the possible inflation and economic climate for 2021, allowing teams to better track possible issues of hyper-inflation, scarcity, individual’s purchasing power and funding mechanisms for social programs.Consultant Objectives Provide a short analysis of Syria’s monetary policy, focusing mainly on 2011-2019  Analyze the current methods of debt security sales and increased money supply by the Syrian Central Bank since mid-2019  Provide insight into possible short to medium term trends of inflation  Develop proxy indicators for measuring money supply (M2) in the absence of public dataConsultant Activities Work with the analysis team to understand the country context  Undertake detailed desk research regarding Syria’s monetary policy  Undertake data analysis of current measurements of money supply and inflation  Be able to apply Monetary Policy theory to the current Syrian situationThe Consultant Will Deliver Consultant Deliverables: Draft report (end of week 3-January 21)  Final Report 15 pages (January 28)  List of proxy indicators of money supply (M2) January 31  Provide a short presentation on key findings to the analysis team (January 31)Timeframe / ScheduleThe consultancy will take place from 1 January 2020 to 31 January 2021.The Consultant Will Report ToThe Consultant will have a direct reporting line to the Humanitarian Access Team’s Director. He/she will work closely with the team’s Data Scientist and Governance Analyst for contextual understanding.Required Experience & Skills Relevant academic qualifications (Masters degree minimum, Ph. D preferred in Economics, Statistics or a related field), and / or 7+ years’ experience in economic research  In-depth knowledge of monetary policy, understanding of the Syrian context is a plus  Knowledge of developing proxy indicators in the absence of public data is a plus  Contextual understanding of Syria  Experience in conducting economic or political economic analysis in conflict affected contexts is a plus  Fluency in written and spoken English is essential, knowledge of Arabic is an asset. Travel:  This is a home-based consultancy, no travel is required. Mercy Corps Diversity StatementAchieving our mission begins with how we build our team and work together. Through our commitment to enriching our organization with people of different origins, beliefs, backgrounds, and ways of thinking, we are better able to leverage the collective power of our teams and solve the world’s most complex challenges. We strive for a culture of trust and respect, where everyone contributes their perspectives and authentic selves, reaches their potential as individuals and teams, and collaborates to do the best work of their lives.We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a journey, and we are committed to learning, listening and evolving to become more diverse, equitable and inclusive than we are today. Equal Employment Opportunity StatementMercy Corps is an equal opportunity employer that does not tolerate discrimination on any basis. We actively seek out diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills so that we can be collectively stronger and have sustained global impact.We are committed to providing an environment of respect and psychological safety where equal employment opportunities are available to all. We do not engage in or tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability (including HIV/AIDS status), marital status, military veteran status or any other protected group in the locations where we work.', ' Consultant Deliverables:', ' Knowledge of developing proxy indicators in the monetary policy, understanding of the Syrian context is a plus', 'Required Experience & Skills', ' Analyze the current methods of debt security sales and increased money supply by the Syrian Central indicators for measuring money supply (M2) in the absence of public data', ' Mercy Corps Diversity Statement', 'Consultant Activities', 'Timeframe / Schedule', ' Fluency in written and spoken English is essential, knowledge of Arabic is an asset.', ' Undertake data analysis of current measurements of money supply and inflation', ' Work with the analysis team to understand the country context We provide our scientists with the\xa0state-of-the-art resources\xa0they need to leverage their time and skills most effectively, empowering small teams of scientists to accomplish what would otherwise require much larger teams.", 'Work with other ICR scientists to leverage company resources and maximize productivity', 'highly collaborative environment', 'a small-group vibe', 'Collaborate in cutting-edge human stem cell R&D and master many aspects of stem cell differentiation, GMP-level production and stem cell genetic and phenotypic characterization', "We'd love to hear from you if your background includes:", 'Associate Research Scientists', 'Excellent English-language communication skills', 'Isolate and characterize stem cell-derived products such as exosomes', 'cell culture, stem cell biology and stem cell production', 'greater NYC area!', "It would be ideal if you're already living in the\xa0greater NYC area!", 'A\xa0BS or MS\xa0in a biomedical sciences field with extensive mammalian cell culture experience', 'The ability to work in the United States without sponsorship', "We're hiring\xa0Associate Research Scientists\xa0with strong backgrounds in cell culture, stem cell biology and stem cell production.\xa0This is a great opportunity for a bright undergraduate looking to go to medical or veterinary school in a few years!", "And you'll definitely need:", 'A\xa0BS or MS\xa0in a biomedical sciences field with extensive mammalian cell culture experienceSolid knowledge of\xa0stem cell culture techniques and modern molecular and cellular biology techniques']

job_title: Senior Scientist II / Principal Research Scientist I, Cellular Biology
job_text: ['', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'Schedule', 'The individual will be fully integrated into several project teams and accountable for the prosecution of project activities leading to team success.', "Demonstrate creative 'out of the box' thinking to solve difficult technical problems and champion new technologies to achieve project goals.", 'Expertise in rodent handling, multiple dosing, physical evaluation and measurement techniques, blood collection, small surgery, in vivo imaging, necropsy, tissue collection and processing for various downstream applications.', 'Process animal tissues and execution of downstream ex vivo analyses including qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA and FACS.', 'Significant Work Activities', 'Hands-on experience with mammal cell culture techniques, sterile tissue processing, primary cell isolation and handling.', 'Travel', 'Develop strategic vision, provide scientific leadership and technical guidance to build a robust panel of in vitro assays to support the discovery, screening, and characterization of novel biologics.', 'Plan and execute in vivo and ex vivo experiments to characterize biologics with novel mechanisms of action. ', 'Lead and mentor a team of highly motivated and gifted scientists.', 'Experience with different imaging techniques and image analysis is highly desirable.', 'Demonstrated ability to plan, execute and troubleshoot experiments to generate reliable and reproducible data in timely manner.', 'Job Level Code', 'BS in Biology or related field with typically 12 - 14+ years of experience; MS or equivalent education with typically 10 - 12+ years of experience; PhD with typically 4 - 6+ years of experience in metabolic diseases, immunology, oncology, aging or related area of discipline.', " BS in Biology or related field with typically 12 - 14+ years of experience; MS or equivalent education with typically 10 - 12+ years of experience; PhD with typically 4 - 6+ years of experience in metabolic diseases, immunology, oncology, aging or related area of discipline. Hands-on experience with mammal cell culture techniques, sterile tissue processing, primary cell isolation and handling. Proficiency in a wide range of molecular biology and immunology techniques (qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA, FACS) for characterization of different aspects of cell biology and a willingness to adopt new skills as needed  Expertise in rodent handling, multiple dosing, physical evaluation and measurement techniques, blood collection, small surgery, in vivo imaging, necropsy, tissue collection and processing for various downstream applications. Experience with different imaging techniques and image analysis is highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to plan, execute and troubleshoot experiments to generate reliable and reproducible data in timely manner. Demonstrate creative 'out of the box' thinking to solve difficult technical problems and champion new technologies to achieve project goals. Experienced and demonstrated success as primary author of publications, presentations, regulatory documents and/or primary inventor of patents. Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organization skills, ability to work in a demanding and intellectually challenging environment, teamwork across multiple scientific disciplines and functions ", ' Develop strategic vision, provide scientific leadership and technical guidance to build a robust panel of in vitro assays to support the discovery, screening, and characterization of novel biologics. Plan and execute in vivo and ex vivo experiments to characterize biologics with novel mechanisms of action.  Demonstrated ability to function as a principle investigator, generating original technical ideas and research strategies. Lead and mentor a team of highly motivated and gifted scientists. Process animal tissues and execution of downstream ex vivo analyses including qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA and FACS. Use multiple techniques to study in vivo distribution of novel biologics, target expression and engagement.  The individual will be fully integrated into several project teams and accountable for the prosecution of project activities leading to team success. ', 'Experienced and demonstrated success as primary author of publications, presentations, regulatory documents and/or primary inventor of patents.', 'Use multiple techniques to study in vivo distribution of novel biologics, target expression and engagement. ', 'Proficiency in a wide range of molecular biology and immunology techniques (qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA, FACS) for characterization of different aspects of cell biology and a willingness to adopt new skills as needed ', 'About AbbVie', 'Demonstrated ability to function as a principle investigator, generating original technical ideas and research strategies.', 'Job Type', 'Qualifications', 'Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organization skills, ability to work in a demanding and intellectually challenging environment, teamwork across multiple scientific disciplines and functions', 'Key Responsibilities']

['', 'Education:', 'DEPARTMENT:\xa0Data Services\xa0', '-Analytical', '-Passionate about data', 'REPORTING SUPERVISOR:\xa0Solutions Architect, Data Services', 'The Data Services team mission is to unify data across the enterprise to optimize the business decisions made at the strategic, tactical, and operational levels of the organization. We accomplish this by providing an Enterprise Data Warehouse, reporting platform, and business processes that can provide quality data, in a timely fashion, from any channel of the company and present it in such a manner to maximize the value of that data for both internal and external customers.', '-Minimum 1 year of experience with database design and/or development required.', '-Strong verbal and written communication skills', 'POSITION:\xa0SQA Data Engineer', '-Detail oriented', 'EMPLOYMENT STATUS:', 'TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:\xa0', 'ABOUT THE TEAM:', '-Under general guidance from other team members and the Quality Department, design effective and maintainable test scripts that can be automated or run as needed to ensure the solution meets the gathered requirements, as well as, meets reliability, accuracy, and performance standards.', 'The Data Engineer (Quality) is responsible for designing, developing, and executing test plans for automated ETL processes. This role will be part of a team adopting and implementing new data technologies and tools like Snowflake, Spark, Hadoop, HDFS, MongoDB and/or others to provide faster, more accurate, and deeper insights into our products and services. As a member of the growing data services and business analytics team, this person will be a key contributor to the successful deployment of strategic future state capabilities critical for our business. As a Data Engineer who is focused on evaluating the quality of the solutions others build, this person is responsible for producing methods of testing the quality of code produced by our Data Engineering staff and adherence to Data Engineering developed standards. This individual will also monitor jobs for performance and error as well as make/suggest changes to address those concerns by working with the members of the Data Engineering team and the Database Administrator. This position will be responsible for designing, documenting, automating, executing, and maintaining test plans and reporting back to the author the results. This individual will implement moderate to complex test scripts to test the functionality.', '-Quality driven', '-Collaborate with various data providers to evaluate and help resolve data issues.', '-Design, document, create, test, and report on the quality of the individual modules, jobs, functions, stored procedures, SQL scripts, etc.', '-Committed to personal development and professional growth', 'Experience:', '-Be an active participant in the development process and possess an understanding of the intent of the design and the desired outcomes of the Data Engineering team members.', '-Experience with big data technologies like Snowflake, Spark, Scala, Kafka, Hbase, Hadoop, HDFS, AVRO, MongoDB are also a plus.', '-Expert knowledge on how to test processes that affect data', '-Minimum 3 years of experience with SQL as a developer or as a member of a quality team required.', '-Produce and maintain accurate test plans and test system overview documentation.', 'TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:\xa0\xa0N/A', '-Minimum 1 year of experience with MS SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB preferred.', '-Moderate to advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Transact-SQL (T-SQL) or ANSI SQL and demonstrated ability to create ad-hoc SQL queries to analyze data, create prototypes, etc.', 'FLSA:', '-Positive and creative attitude', '\ufeffPersonal Attributes:', '-Occasionally take on special projects and additional duties.\xa0', 'ABOUT THE JOB:', 'DEPARTMENT:', 'DIRECT REPORTS:', 'RESPONSIBILITIES:', "Education:\xa0Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience\xa0", 'EMPLOYMENT STATUS:\xa0Direct Hire', '-Familiarity with visual data analysis using tools such as Tableau or other Business Intelligence platforms', 'Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:', 'REPORTING SUPERVISOR:\xa0', 'FLSA:\xa0Non-Exempt', '-Review for existing standards and adjust to new standards as they mature.', 'QUALIFICATIONS:', 'POSITION:', 'DIRECT REPORTS:\xa0No', '-Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Work closely with development teams outside the Data Engineering group, including, Business Intelligence Developers, Product Development, and Data Scientists, who will use the data being delivered.']

Pharmaceutical Sciences, or related science field with 3 – 5 years relevant laboratory experience in the pharmaceutical industry', '• Must be able to work on multiple concurrent projects, and communicate effectively with interdisciplinary project teams', '• Maintain appropriate documentation (records and lab notebooks).', '• Convey experimental and analytical results to clients in data summaries and reports.', '• Interpret data from a wide range of solid-state and particle characterization techniques.', '• Good problem solving and decision making skills to identify and solve work related issues', '• Comply with good housekeeping and safety practices according to AMRI Environmental Health and Safety policies', '• Good written and oral communication skills', 'AMRI provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.', '• Familiarity with solid state characterization techniques such as XRPD, DSC, TGA, vapor sorption, and 1 H NMR.', '\ufeffAll interested applicants must apply online.\xa0AMRI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\xa0All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.', '• Comply with all cGMP, laboratory SOPs, and company policies and procedures', 'The Research Scientist II is an integral part of the AMRI team, contributing to our success by being part of the most trusted provider of drug discovery, development and manufacturing services for pharmaceutical and biotech innovators. To accomplish this, we provide exceptional scientific expertise and maintain relationships with customers by demonstrating service that goes above and beyond the ordinary. Having the right people on our team is critical to this mission.', 'We are recruiting for a scientific contributor for our West Lafayette,Indiana facility. The main activities of the Research Scientist II will be to perform solid from screening, interpret solid state analytical data, and report the results.', '• Collaborate with co-workers and contribute to team activities.', '• Perform laboratory experiments in the areas of crystallization process development and solid form screening of pharmaceutical compounds.', "• Meet timelines for delivering on clients' expectations.", '• Communicate clearly and accurately with internal and external clients, both verbally and through written data summaries and reports.', '• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Word and the ability to learn other scientific software packages, as required', '• Experience with solid form screening including polymorph, salt and cocrystal screening']

job_title: AI Research scientist: up to $350,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'Coming up with new techniques in unsupervised learning, dataset augmentation, and deep reinforcement learning that can be applied to automating various parts of the AI development workflow.', 'General Requirements:', 'We are looking for talented research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Candidates will need to have a PhD preferably in Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning. We are looking for people who have done research and/or published papers in one of the following areas: Unsupervised Learning; Generative Modeling; Deep Neural Networks; Deep Reinforcement Learning; Generative Adversarial Networks; Causal Reasoning. Ideal candidates would be able to rapidly build on new ideas with engineers, potentially publish at top conferences, and be able to write code.', 'Job Description:', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting-edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. We have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We are backed by Eric Schmidt and Decibel Ventures with Series A funding of $18 million.\xa0']

['', 'Designing, synthesizing, evaluating and optimizing novel polymer membrane coatings for amperometric, potentiometric and voltammetric biosensors for intradermal applications', "Designing, synthesizing, evaluating and optimizing novel polymer membrane coatings for amperometric, potentiometric and voltammetric biosensors for intradermal applicationsDeveloping novel polymers for enzyme immobilization and electrical interfacing in conjunction with the R&D teamConforming to the Company's quality management system framework; compiling test protocols, procedures and reportsTranslating sensor designs to the production environment; designing sensors for manufacture to achieve cost and performance targetsImplementing statistical analyses of datasets acquired in the R&D setting to corroborate meaningful resultsWorking closely with the Company's quality management team to ensure strict conformance to established protocols and completion of studies in a timely and cost-effective mannerDefining statistical measures of significance and benchmarks for accuracy, generating documentation and written procedures, reporting on experimental findings and iteratively improving sensor designs based upon feedback from management", "Working closely with the Company's quality management team to ensure strict conformance to established protocols and completion of studies in a timely and cost-effective manner", 'Ability to interface with R&D team and work in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment', 'Strong hydrogel synthesis and characterization background, ability to design and synthesize hydrogels with desired properties', 'Experience with reverse iontophoresis, hydrogels, glucose sensing, polymer membrane synthesis, application and biological interactions, surface chemistry, electroanalytical methods and (preferably) electrochemical biosensors', 'Implementing statistical analyses of datasets acquired in the R&D setting to corroborate meaningful results', 'What you will be responsible for:', "This is a dynamic role and part of a team of engineers developing various medical devices and biosensors. It is a highly influential role within the Company, using extensive knowledge of reverse iontophoresis, hydrogels, polymer science, including polymer synthesis and polymer property tailoring, electrochemistry, surface chemistry, organic chemistry and statistical data analysis. You will have the opportunity to help define the direction of the company's valued product from sensor design and development, synthesis, evaluation and analysis to assessing performance benchmarks. You will be responsible for critical reviews of the scientific literature related to polymer membrane synthesis and characterization and sensor construction and will be intimately involved with design-for-manufacture (DFM) and statistical process control (SPC). You will work closely with company engineers and with outside consultants on optimizing methods of enhancing sensor sensitivity, selectivity, operational and storage stability, response time, linearity, dynamic range, limit-of-detection and uniformity. You will demonstrate your sound analytical skills in designing experiments to generate statistically significant results, implementing protocols to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, including operating under design controls and FDA and ISO regulations, and making recommendations to management based on the significance of the results.", 'At Monitor Health we fully subscribe to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. It is our policy to provide employment, compensation, and other benefits related to employment based on qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. In accordance with requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable federal, state and/or local laws, it is our policy to provide reasonable accommodation upon request during the application process to applicants in order that they may be given a full and fair opportunity to be considered for employment. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we intend to comply fully with applicable federal, state and/or local employment laws and the information requested on this application will only be used for purposes consistent with those laws. To the extent required by applicable law, The Company maintains a smoke- free workplace. We are e-verified.', 'Capacity to manage multiple projects and communicate ideas clearly to the team; excellent written and verbal communication skills', 'Familiarity with microfluidics, data analysis tools (i.e. Excel, Matlab, R) and methods; Thorough knowledge of all relevant sub-specialty area industry, health and safety, federal, and state regulations.', 'Proven ability to multi-task and reliably manage multiple projects through from inception to completion on schedule in a complex, challenging environment. Flexibility to adjust to constantly changing priorities.', 'Interpersonal skills to independently convey information with authority, handle highly sensitive matters and interact with high level contacts from other organizations.', 'The Department and University have supported three faculty members, Drs. Knight, Yeo, and Laurent, in establishing a high-throughput clinical COVID-19 testing laboratory. Employees hired through this posting will serve as General Supervisors for this laboratory.', 'The incumbent will: -- Write, review, and update policies and procedures (SOP’s) in accordance with State of California, CLIA and CAP guidelines. -- Determine that work is properly completed and reported -- Maintain and monitor the quality control of procedures in compliance with departmental policies and CLIA/CAP regulatoryrequirements -- Maintain quality improvement data and statistics. -- Orient new employees, prepare work schedules and work assignments, conduct interviews and counseling, provide performance evaluations of direct reports. -- Keep superiors regularly informed of personnel performance or problems, scheduling problems, difficulties with procedures, equipment, supplies or other daily activities. -- Develop and maintain appropriate inventory of supplies to ensure smooth operation. -- Train direct reports on procedural changes, policy changes and general information. -- Ensure that instrument preventive maintenance, calibration, and trouble-shooting are properly performed. -- Provide input to the Lab Director and the Director of Medical Services on laboratory operation. -- Introduce new procedures or methodologies in-house. Participate in method updates and validation. -- Perform trouble-shooting and minor equipment maintenance -- Prepare and process specimens for lab testing. -- Perform and evaluate laboratory tests based on nucleic and protein detection and quantification. -- Use, maintain and upgrade laboratory information systems as needed. -- Generate worksheets and reports. Throughout these tasks, the incumbent will follow guidelines to ensure continued State and CLIA Licensure for the lab.', 'The incumbent will work in the UCSD Biochemical Genetics Laboratory which is a California Licensed, CLIA and CAP approved Clinical Laboratory. The Biochemical Genetics Lab is an independent reference laboratory that performs clinical tests for pediatric metabolic disorders, as well as clinical testing related to COVID-19. Under general supervision, the incumbent is assigned supervisory and technical responsibility for technologists performing a variety of standard and/or complex clinical assays performed using semi-automated workflows, at a rate of up to 10,000 assays/day.', 'Nine years of related experience, education/training, OR a Bachelor’s degree in related area plus five years of related experience/training.Possession of current Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS) license issued by the California State Department of Health.Maintains current knowledge of laboratory concepts, new methodologies and advances in the field of specimen processing, automation, and procedures. Ability to apply principles in a clinical laboratory setting.Knowledge of Clinical Laboratory, medical center, HR and UC policies and processes. Thorough knowledge of all relevant sub-specialty area industry, health and safety, federal, and state regulations.Ability to organize assigned staff and laboratory operations in an efficient and effective manner. Highly developed personal organizational skills. Knowledge of quality assurance methods and ability to apply principles to design quality systems.Proven ability to multi-task and reliably manage multiple projects through from inception to completion on schedule in a complex, challenging environment. Flexibility to adjust to constantly changing priorities.Verbal and written communication skills to explain technical clinical specialty concepts, actively listen, persuade, advise, and counsel.Ability to use laboratory’s application programs. Skills to perform data checks using queries, visual review and other appropriate means to verify data accuracy.Skills to evaluate issues and identify solutions within defined procedures and policies. Demonstrated ability to solve problems and suggest solutions through critical thinking process.Interpersonal skills to independently convey information with authority, handle highly sensitive matters and interact with high level contacts from other organizations.', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Ability to use laboratory’s application programs. Skills to perform data checks using queries, visual review and other appropriate means to verify data accuracy.', 'Skills to evaluate issues and identify solutions within defined procedures and policies. Demonstrated ability to solve problems and suggest solutions through critical thinking process.', 'One to two years of work experience as a California licensed Clinical Laboratory Scientist.', 'Possession of current Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS) license issued by the California State Department of Health.', 'Maintains current knowledge of laboratory concepts, new methodologies and advances in the field of specimen processing, automation, and procedures. Ability to apply principles in a clinical laboratory setting.', 'Verbal and written communication skills to explain technical clinical specialty concepts, actively listen, persuade, advise, and counsel.']

job_title: Senior Research Scientist II- Chemical Development
job_text: ['', '• Use a broad spectrum of practical laboratory skills as needed; including advanced methods of purification of solvents and reagents, running reactions under anhydrous and oxygen free conditions, and using advanced methods for isolation/purification of sensitive materials.', '• Utilize all available techniques and analytical instrumentation such as: NMR, IR, & HPLC for monitoring laboratory experiments and the analysis of products effectively.', '• Synthesize target compounds utilizing a blend of both classical and modern technology effectively.', '• Follow responsible actions regarding chemical disposal.\xa0Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels.', 'RESPONSIBILITIES', "• Contribute technically to the Company's web site; seek opportunities to publish.", '• Find new and better ways of performing job by challenging established procedures.\xa0Require minimal supervision, bring assignments to completion independently.', '• Recommend and implement methods to increase the quality of products and/or service.', 'Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.', "The Senior Research Scientist, Chemical Development, is an expert synthetic organic chemist.\xa0The scientist's principal responsibility is in the design, synthesis, purification and identification of chemical intermediates and target compounds.\xa0The scientist is expected to provide contributions to the chemical problems assigned. The scientist is self-motivated and demonstrates initiative in responsibilities and always strives to do the job better.", '• Contribute suggestions to coworkers.', '• Ph.D. Degree in Organic Chemistry or equivalent experience', '• Communicate effectively in verbal and written form on research results, issues, and plans.', '• Adapt to changing priorities such that productivity is unaffected.', '• Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner.\xa0Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan.\xa0Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices.', '• Lead projects and small team on junior scientist', '• Modify reaction conditions in accord with visual observations to allow rapid, successful production of target compounds.', 'All interested applicants must apply online. AMRI is an Equal Opportunity Employer, we value diversity and inclusiveness. Minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity are encouraged to apply.', '• Manage workload and time to enable the incumbent to perform multiple projects effectively, and ensure all necessary paperwork is completed on a timely basis.', '• Organize work time so that several reactions are run concurrently.\xa0Use time efficiently to produce target compounds with investigation of side reactions being normally given low priority.', 'QUALIFICATIONS', '• Conduct literature searches for specific target compounds, structures related to the target compound, or to determine specific conditions for compounds and reactions.\xa0Keep abreast of current scientific literature and discuss new findings with colleagues.', '• Discuss routinely with supervisor the status of the assigned programs and potential problems.', '• 7+ years Industry experience. Experience in Process Development Chemistry preferred.']

job_title: Sr. Researcher/Staff Researcher, Twitter Emerging Businesses
job_text: ['', 'Represent Twitter research internally (e.g., to xfn teams, Staff, at all-hands meetings) and externally (e.g., via blog posts, conference presentations, white papers).', 'Responsibilities', 'Lead the proactive discovery, exploration and development of insights to drive strategy to deliver potential non-ads revenue product solutions for Twitter.Promote and lead the building of foresight and synthesis of trends through investigation of rapidly shifting marketplace dynamics, emerging data sources & technologies and the ever-changing consumer and business landscape by connecting the dots, seeding ideas, and storytelling to drive better business decisions around emerging opportunitiesLead purposeful relationship-building with a wide array of partners (e.g., Design, Product, Engineering), other research teams, and beyond.Represent Twitter research internally (e.g., to xfn teams, Staff, at all-hands meetings) and externally (e.g., via blog posts, conference presentations, white papers).', 'What You’ll Do ', 'Lead purposeful relationship-building with a wide array of partners (e.g., Design, Product, Engineering), other research teams, and beyond.', 'Lead the proactive discovery, exploration and development of insights to drive strategy to deliver potential non-ads revenue product solutions for Twitter.', 'Promote and lead the building of foresight and synthesis of trends through investigation of rapidly shifting marketplace dynamics, emerging data sources & technologies and the ever-changing consumer and business landscape by connecting the dots, seeding ideas, and storytelling to drive better business decisions around emerging opportunities', 'Job Description']
